C086D0E5502C49A897B7884CF5E6357E.description: Examine the effects of ethical and unethical practices in product design and development.

D8FA262517B049869F09014B40D94AEC.description: Explain ethical issues that may arise from the use of new technologies.

BEC15EC4FE3A4A6584F6D1812AD7E399.description:
Technological disparities have consequences
for public health and prosperity.Â

3DD23BD3A1864B0995559E5EA58A4746.description: Compare the environmental effects of two alternative technologies devised to address climate change issues and use data to justify which choice is best.

9F5FB08469864B1A81594A1F695B0844.description: Analyze the design of a product that negatively impacts the environment or society and develop possible solutions to lessen its impact.

87AB581559AD4C24ADF5F95AECA66A6F.description: Analyze the impact of modifying resources in a product or system (e.g., materials, energy, information, time, tools, people, capital).

6EBC5352E2BF4C618E672467059E8CEE.description: Illustrate how a product is upcycled into a new product and analyze the short- and long-term benefits and costs.

CB2B8FCA0F3041FE9A8D419015CC2F5A.description:
Resources need to be utilized wisely to have
positive effects on the environment and
society.
Some technological decisions involve tradeoffs between environmental and economic
needs, while others have positive effects for
both the economy and environment

73C7A43D82774FEA9CFF7E899BD02DD9.description: Effects of Technology on the Natural World

4C96651E731041C6AF04896890221C24.description: Explain how a product designed for a specific demand was modified to meet a new demand and led to a new product.

2540AAA6FEEC4FE18C069FBFAC7DB4B0.description: Examine a system, consider how each part relates to other parts, and redesign it for another purpose.

570C50E7EE90434DB15FDD94B8B299A4.description: Analyze an existing technological product that has been repurposed for a different function.

3415D4D2804B400EBABD02DDD25351B6.description: Examine a malfunctioning tool, product, or system and propose solutions to the problem.

C7EEBEC6C69C4ED5A3972BB12809B789.description:
Technology advances through the processes of
innovation and invention which relies upon the
imaginative and inventive nature of people.
Sometimes a technology developed for one
purpose is adapted to serve other purposes.
Engineers use a systematic process of creating
or modifying technologies that is fueled and
constrained by physical laws, cultural norms,
and economic resources. Scientists use
systematic investigation to understand the
natural world.Â

AD6344D278EF4986BF410BE524A7CC24.description: Compare the impacts of a given technology on different societies, noting factors that may make a technology appropriate and sustainable in one society but not in another.

49D0D483927D4562A97665FF6A49E2BE.description: Identify technologies that have been designed to reduce the negative consequences of other technologies and explain the change in impact.

A3AC32BF285E4C6BAE9821A3FB8B6914.description: Evaluate the impact of sustainability on the development of a designed product or system.

75AB858F58614E87B7413AAF17E4364B.description: Compare how technologies have influenced society over time

94A87D05F6F14F31802B5321677B2162.description:
Technology interacts with society, sometimes
bringing about changes in a societyâs
economy, politics, and culture, and often
leading to the creation of new needs and
wants.
New needs and wants may create strains on
local economies and workforces.
Improvements in technology are intended to
make the completion of tasks easier, safer,
and/or more efficient.

F90ED0329B2C44F6ABE4658B305B0620.description: Explain how the development and use of technology influences economic, political, social, and cultural issues.

1AC00D773F0F4F4BA0E40DFBA2E03BE2.description:
Economic, political, social and cultural aspects
of society drive development of new
technological products, processes, and
systems.

20EA3948108B44C9A02B78A2BBDABDEB.description: Design a product to address a real-world problem and document the iterative design process, including decisions made as a result of specific constraints and trade-offs (e.g., annotated sketches).

2EE42BF951414E55BA683941DFA14CA2.description: Analyze how trade-offs can impact the design of a product.

F1E05B17BAD24EDDA1BD5DBF63D377EB.description: Explain the need for optimization in a design process.

13DBB284707A4E50AADA4EC561B87B8B.description:
Engineering design requirements and
specifications involve making trade-offs
between competing requirements and desired
design features.

18AD03AADBC241BF966A3E621E726DAB.description: Investigate a malfunctioning system, identify its impact, and explain the step-by-step process used to troubleshoot, evaluate, and test options to repair the product in a collaborative team.

D76BB7D83B3E4B66B10B92E41005B749.description: Develop a proposal for a solution to a real-world problem that includes a model (e.g., physical prototype, graphical/technical sketch).

C83123A2D12C4D03B149F8A88F618883.description: Identify the steps in the design process that could be used to solve a problem.

37868E5F51DB488D8EA4A26C1AA650B7.description: Evaluate the function, value, and aesthetics of a technological product or system, from the perspective of the user and the producer.

61F56314F9BE487B9F9D7247A16DB2DB.description:
Engineering design is a systematic, creative,
and iterative process used to address local and
global problems.
The process includes generating ideas,
choosing the best solution, and making,
testing, and redesigning models or prototypes.

77FBB651EA984FB2A14B43D0FC6A6435.description: Document programs in order to make them easier to follow, test, and debug.

3CB1569B91754C4B95EE0F7325E82255.description: Systematically test and refine programs using a range of test cases and users.

239D7F560B18445B9A31058264E375EF.description: Design programs, incorporating existing code, media, and libraries, and give attribution.

782E4AD44B6B4DC09DB28719C6C78475.description: Refine a solution that meets usersâ needs by incorporating feedback from team members and users.

82FFD6BCEE8941F6957A3EAE0E824B62.description:
Individuals design and test solutions to identify
problems taking into consideration the diverse
needs of the users and the community.Â

967C8F48D5DB4177847C5CDE8CE29A8A.description: Create procedures with parameters to organize code and make it easier to reuse.

8B028DD4593E49E9A0CD74D08A0A63EB.description:
Decompose problems and sub-problems into parts to facilitate the design,
implementation, and review of programs.

305CD7AD6F8049A2AD600696C7CF49F2.description:
Programs use procedures to organize code and
hide implementation details. Procedures can be
repurposed in new programs. Defining
parameters for procedures can generalize
behavior and increase reusability.

927E2F596EED47AEA6C777559D4B0E26.description: Design and iteratively develop programs that combine control structures, including nested loops and compound conditionals.

9707D4E4525542DD815EAB4849BEAAB2.description:
Control structures are selected and combined
in programs to solve more complex problems.

0BA2B7A86BC54F1C8B2419FB0675C440.description: Create clearly named variables that represent different data types and perform operations on their values.

9E90047A77994D95A7C4B1B039451AAB.description:
Programmers create variables to store data
values of different types and perform
appropriate operations on their values.Â

6093CEA1CD034E44806C56075E2E29F8.description: Design and illustrate algorithms that solve complex problems using flowcharts and/or pseudocode.

A8B4CFA80D384501B06D94AF17282A1B.description:
Individuals design algorithms that are reusable
in many situations.
Algorithms that are readable are easier to
follow, test, and debug.Â

41254099057946C7B154287B7A806FB4.description: Analyze climate change computational models and propose refinements.

B53CE3EC3DE0455D8319BCB47F950A24.description: Test, analyze, and refine computational models.

2208E3D03B154C72A7C0A8C9394E5710.description:
Computer models can be used to simulate
events, examine theories and inferences, or
make predictions.Â

3957810266DD4B69A77A79D82667A4BA.description: Transform data to remove errors and improve the accuracy of the data for analysis.

727FE4C36655433A90E5F7229F869DC7.description:
The purpose of cleaning data is to remove
errors and make it easier for computers to
process.Â

3AF86388CC2E41EE963C42CD8BF26F37.description: Identify the appropriate tool to access data based on its file format.

5379FC945CF448CEBC4F93B2F96288F8.description: Explain the difference between how the computer stores data as bits and how the data is displayed.

61200B7098514182A0B7BEDE48AEB224.description:
Data is represented in many formats. Software
tools translate the low-level representation of
bits into a form understandable by individuals.
Data is organized and accessible based on the
application used to store it.Â

016CFCCBD08F48B598FF8FF4DD21D447.description: Organize and transform data collected using computational tools to make it usable for a specific purpose.

FE23E8CD766444378FD8C3443DCC6DB3.description:
People use digital devices and tools to
automate the collection, use, and
transformation of data.
The manner in which data is collected and
transformed is influenced by the type of digital
device(s) available and the intended use of the
data

F07BD4F49C3C4982A77EA91465072A51.description: Describe issues of bias and accessibility in the design of existing technologies.

F5FFBE23CE334B3D8F21AC1D7C111FFD.description: Compare the trade-offs associated with computing technologies that affect individualâs everyday activities and career options.

4688C924CFF44E419C1DCE8B02ECA0D1.description:
Advancements in computing technology can
change individualsâ behaviors.
Society is faced with trade-offs due to the
increasing globalization and automation that
computing brings.Â

294332ECCD434E7A91701A91B68D463A.description: Explain how new security measures have been created in response to key malware events.

4126A342A08D4FB4BDEAA1A934024BEC.description: Explain how network security depends on a combination of hardware, software, and practices that control access to data and systems.

1AE5F1E8A47A483B9ED29AF76CAFED48.description:
The information sent and received across
networks can be protected from unauthorized
access and modification in a variety of ways.
The evolution of malware leads to
understanding the key security measures and
best practices needed to proactively address
the threat to digital data.

C87A400BD42946D1AB6703C7BF85B4CD.description: Model the role of protocols in transmitting data across networks and the Internet and how they enable secure and errorless communication.

135D27DDA884424D98F543425C5B52F2.description: Model how information is broken down into smaller pieces, transmitted as addressed packets through multiple devices over networks and the Internet, and reassembled at the destination.

22896F11CECD4AF5974230FB0CCEAE53.description:
Protocols, packets, and addressing are the key
components for reliable delivery of
information across networks.Â

E71937B577634D528E8A5CC2A4225FC1.description:
Systematically apply troubleshooting strategies to identify and resolve hardware and
software problems in computing systems.

3C7A19E3B4DE4E09800E2B6BF0F016DD.description:
Troubleshooting a problem is more effective
when knowledge of the specific device along
with a systematic process is used to identify
the source of a problem.Â

091BB988E467455681AFD7BA22B1B177.description: Justify design decisions and explain potential system trade-offs.

EBC2C04D6D4644E49F460514B654B0E1.description: Design a system that combines hardware and software components to process data.

8FBC24F7FA3144B29AAB49A2EB4017C7.description:
Software and hardware determine a computing
systemâs capability to store and process
information. The design or selection of a
computing system involves multiple
considerations and potential trade-offs.

908B6D1DFD154B0F943849C807E9DEAD.description: Recommend improvements to computing devices in order to improve the ways users interact with the devices.

00F5E21D83884174A4D5029233D9A310.description:
The study of humanâcomputer interaction can
improve the design of devices and extend the
abilities of humans.Â
